reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When me and my boyfriend arrived at the hotel an hour and a half early, we were told out room was already ready! We had room 224 at the back of the hotel, at the end of the corridoor so it was nice and tucked out of the way :) The room was lovely, and we soon settled in. The only thing i would say is that there was some black mould on the ceiling near the window, but this didnt really bother us! The bed was massive which was really nice! The lounge area, downstairs by the bar was ful of chesterfield sofas and with free wifi it was a great place to wait whilst waiting to be seated for dinner. Dinner in the hotel resturant was lovely and very reasonably priced for three courses for £24.95. The waitresses were all really helpful, especially a lady called Ellen, who was so lovely and polite she really made my trip! Breakfast the next morning was tasty, apart from the fact i asked for a poached egg, and when it came mine and my boyfriends eggs were stone cold all the way through. The spa was really nice, but we didnt get a robe or slippers? Not sure if you have to have a treatment to get those? However we did use the tanning bed, and there was no information or advice about it so we were unsure as to how long to go on for, how often etc which led to us getting a bit burnt! The hyrda pool was really quiet at all times when we went in which was really nice to have it to ourselves. The second meal of our stay was really nice and again breakfast the next morning was much better as we both had hot scrambled egg this time. We checked out an hour early as we had a long way to drive back, and 20 mins into our journey realised i had left my glasses in the dresser draw, after calling them they were more than happy to check my room and bring them down for me to collect. I can comment on the price as we had our 2 night stay brought for us as a present, but overall it was really lovley, set in a beautiful place which made it very romantic and i would definatley go back again!!!
reviews.title: Best short break ever for a young couple!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Positive-Overall the Hotel was great. Friendly staff (especially Sally on reception and the ex pat scouser on the bar), clean hotel, nice (but tired) room. Spa was lovely, great and tasty meals, lovely location.
reviews.title: Spa? Sorry la.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Negative- I booked the Romantric Break, to take full advantage of their Spa facilities, massage etc for my girlfiends birthday. Unfortunatley there where no appointments available. To be honest, I don't think they have enough staff to offer this service. The hotel was nowhere near full, and people we met hadn't been able to book any facilities either. I would suggest if you want a massage, buy one of those plug in ones for your car, or book a year in advance.
reviews.title: This is a good 3* hotel - excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As part of the break you have a bouquet of flowers and chocolates, waiting in your room on arrival. I did request freesias, my partners favourite flowers. Only to be told that it wasn't possible, but, the bouquet would be of a high quality. I'm sorry, but my idea of quality is not a couple of rancid twigs and flowers, obviously left over from a wedding some months ago. Appalling. Don't buy flowers from their preffered florist
reviews.title: Gorgeous hotel - if you are willing to splurge for the suite!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: SUMMARY “You get what you pay for - this is a good 3* Hotel” - I am a seasoned traveller and accept all the other reviews for this hotel, which are largely correct but can be taken out of context. This is Llangollen which is a lovely setting, the hotel is well positioned and for £49 per night for a Double Room B&B (<£25 each) - this represents good value - with free use of the spa facilities. (+) Restaurant, Spa, location (-) Bar service, Coffee.
reviews.title: Such a shame, so dissapointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As other reviewers have said, you get what you pay for. At £49 per night for 2 people B&B, you can't really complain. This hotel does represent good value a for money and the spa makes it even more so. The room we stayed in was dated, the TV took up too much room for a small room and the bathroom was pretty poor (shower bad, pokey room and hairs in the shower and extractor fan), the TV crackled a lot as an old tv would do and we could hear people in the hall way/neighouring rooms. However, we didn't expect 5 star luxury at the price we were paying.
reviews.title: Good value for money but don't eat in the restaurant!

reviews.text: We ate in the restaurant on the first night, and I have to say, you really would be much better off by walking 10 minutes into Llangollen and eating at the Corn Mill, which has outstanding food at similar prices. The Wild Pheasant Hotel restaurant was below standard. Nothing tasted of anything and was cooked very poorly. We didn't eat our meal and at £56 for 2 courses each (we didn't want a desert after what we'd experienced) it was not cheap. It is a shame because I think that they could do well if they changed just a few things. The breakfast in the morning however, was ok (I didn't have the full English - just the smoked haddock with poached egg, which was good).
reviews.title: Excellent food for party of 19

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You might struggle to find a member of staff who smiles - the guy who booked us in on arrival being the exception along with a girl in the Impressions spa with short dark hair. Everyone else was very moody and it seemed as though they thought the customers were an inconvenience.
reviews.title: Fantastic value for money, definately use this hotel again

reviews.text: We did have a good stay in Llangollen, and I would recommend this hotel if you just want somewhere to stay so you can go out and explore. The Spa was quite good (a few of the jets didn't work and it was quite busy sometimes) and was a nice extra. I certainly don't recommend the restaurant though, I'm sorry to say.
reviews.title: stayed in worse but had better!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rates are confusing. The special-offer banner draped across the car-park, offering B& B for £10 per night is verging on misleading as "conditions apply" is taken to a new level.
reviews.title: Lovely area!

reviews.text: Actually, to achieve this amazing offer, one has to eat in the restaurant from a table d'hote menu which costs approximately £25 per head. So the minimum charge is a few pennies short of £70 per night, per couple D B&B. On Fridays and Saturdays this rate is £99 per couple DB&B. As these prices are absolutely fine, I don't know why the hotel isn't more frank about them, and get rid of the silly banner - which annoyed me with its gimmicky over-selling of a reasonable deal. If you book through a booking agent the rates may be different again. The prices given are a special offer and for a limited period, so check prices carefully when you book, and book direct with the hotel for best deals.
reviews.title: friendly effective service

reviews.text: Residents are entitled to use the spa facilities but it seems that pamper-day beauty-salon customers are given priority for locker keys, towelling robes and even entry to the spa. A maximum of 16 users at one time can make it difficult for hotel guests to gain access to the facilities during busy times.
reviews.title: friendly staff nice surroundings but disapointed spa treatments not available

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was too hot for us. Stuffy over-heating made us uncomfortable at various times during our stay.
reviews.title: great value

reviews.text: Dissappointing stay. Breakfast is tasteless. No one asked if we enjoyed our stay when we checked out. They wanted £10 to stay in room extra hour for late checkout. No Wifi in rooms. Loud rock music playing in spa rather than relaxing spa music. Shower in pool a building site and jacussi water level too low so spits at your back and over your head.
reviews.title: they forget the finishing touches

reviews.text: Our bedroom was like a buzzing sound chamber when the air conditioning and bathroom fan were going and only way to stop them was to pull out room key.
reviews.title: Better than we might have feared - worth a stay.

reviews.text: They are trying at this hotel........ but not hard enough given the cost.
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I travelled to Llangollen with a friend to celebrate my birthday and we bookede two night's B&B. At £49 per night for the two of us the value was certainly exceptional. Having read a few reviews here we were in two minds about what we would experience but on the whole we were pleased with our stay.
reviews.title: Solid Hotel, worth a visit could do better.

reviews.text: The hotel is about a ten minutes stroll from the town centre (that's a real 10 minutes, not a travel agent's 10 minutes) and the setting of the hotel is very pleasant. Reception is clean and modern and we were efficiently booked in. The room was a doubloe overlooking a small garden with a fountain - so was very quiet and peaceful. The room itself was maybe a tiny bit dated in terms of its decoration but was clean and comfortable and had all the basics one would require. Perhaps the only thing that was rather odd was that the bed seemed very short. I am a little under six foot and even when my head was almost touching the headboard my feet were at the very end of the mattress. I was okbut I suspect any taller guests would find this a bit of an issue.
reviews.title: Went out for dinner- the worst service i have ever experienced!
